fields.description: We feel that the user will like it if we provide a link to the FishEye page, maybe http://<hostname>/source/browse, in the "success" dialog after a dump file was successfully imported. This way the user can clearly see what we have imported for them.
fields.summary: SVN-Importer: better to provide a link to FishEye main page in the "success" dialog

fields.description: It would be nice to provide a link on the importer's main UI, probably within the "Information" section, pointing to the Studio documentation page for the SVN importer. This way the user will always get the latest help information. (The draft documentation page is here: http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRASTUDIO/REV240+-+Importing+Versioned+Data+into+Subversion)
fields.summary: SVN-Importer: better to have a link to Studio documentation page

fields.description: Currently the {{/data/jirastudio/svn}} directory is owned by {{root}}. For the SVN-importer to work, we need to change its owner/group to {{apache:js-jira}}. (See https://collab.contegix.com/browse/AOD-556). If this change hasn't been implemented, then the SVN-importer will fail to create a new {{/data/jirastudio/svn/*root*}} directory after it has renamed it to {{/data/jirastudio/svn/*root.back*}}. This leaves the SVN repository in an incorrect state. To prevent this from happening, probably the importer should check whether or not it has the required permission to create the {{/data/jirastudio/svn/*root*}} directory before renaming it.
fields.summary: SVN-Importer: better to check directory creation permissions before renaming svn root directory

fields.description: Gliffy admin link is shown under Administration -> Gliffy Plugin Administration but Balsamiq is not shown at all.
fields.summary: Gliffy and Balsamiq administration links are not shown in Confluence for a restricted administrator

fields.summary: Tests for initial data population in JIRA

fields.description:
As per JIRA 4.2, custom index and attachment paths are not allowed anymore. If you're trying to import a backup file from < 4.2, JIRA will honour the custom paths and use them. If the directories don't exist, the importer asks you if you want to fallback to the default paths.

The Studio importer will report this type of error to the frontend, but does not offer the option to fallback. This causes extra effort for Support, since the current process, to just take the customer's file as it is and change the paths later, won't work anymore. 

Current workaround: Open XML file, search for OSPropertyEntry elements with propertyKey jira.path.attachments.use.default.directory and jira.path.index.use.default.directory, copy the value of the id attribute and search for the corresponding OSPropertyNumber elements with that id. Change their value from 0 to 1.

The task here is to support this fallback for the Studio importer as well.
fields.summary: Support fallback to default paths

{panel:title=Atlassian Status as of 17 September 2014|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#3C78B5| titleBGColor=#3C78B5| bgColor=#E7F4FA}
Hi everyone,
 
Thanks so much for your votes and comments on this issue.
 
Atlassian is working hard on Atlassian Connect, Atlassian's strategic integration platform enabling ecosystem vendors to develop add-ons for Atlassian Cloud (OnDemand). Atlassian Connect 1.0 [was released in March 2014|http://blogs.atlassian.com/2014/03/introducing-atlassian-connect-1-0/], and you can already get access to [more than 50 public add-ons today built using the platform|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/search?application=&category=&cost=&hosting=cloud&marketingLabel=].
 
Due to stability and scalability reasons, we will not bundle additional third party add-ons with our Cloud offerings. But you should feel free to contact the vendors of your favourite add-ons to let them know that you would like them to create a Cloud version of the add-on! We will do our best to work together with the vendor to satisfy this request.
 
Since we have no plans to bundle additional add-ons in Cloud, we are closing this issue.
 
Cheers,
Bartek
JIRA Product Management
bartek (at) atlassian (dot) com
{panel}
 
 
*Original request description:*
Request to bundle [Subversion JIRA plugin|https://studio.plugins.atlassian.com/wiki/display/SVN/Subversion+JIRA+plugin] into OnDemand.

A plugin to integrate JIRA with Subversion.This plugin displays Subversion commit info in a tab on the associated JIRA issue. To link a commit to a JIRA issue, the commit's text must contain the issue key (eg. "This commit fixes TST-123 "). 

Related issues:
- https://support.atlassian.com/browse/JST-14367
fields.summary: Bundle Subversion JIRA plugin into OnDemand

fields.description:
On unicorn, it will sometimes be necessary to start up a large number of instances on a server at the same time. This creates substantial load on the system, and causes applications to start up quite slowly, sometimes slow enough to trigger the plugin dependency resolution timeout in the plugin system. Most of the time this will cause the applications to start up in an unusable state.

Attached are two log files, one where the atlassian template renderer failed to load within the timeout, causing many other plugins to fail to load ([^jira.log]), and the other where the atlassian notifier plugin fails to load, which causes the studio crowd plugin to fail to load ([^crowd.log]).

Instead of continuing to start up in a broken state, the application should abort startup if a plugin fails to load. This way some sort of automatic recovery on unicorn could be implemented.

The workaround for this is to increase the plugin load timeout by using the jvm parameter {{-Datlassian.plugins.enable.wait=<seconds>}}.

Related links:
* [http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/JIRA+Plugin+System+Timeout+due+to+'Timeout+While+Waiting+for+Plugin+to+Enable']
* [http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CONFKB/Plugins+are+Disabled+at+Startup+and+Various+Timeout+Errors+Appear+in+the+Logs+After+Startup]
fields.summary: abort startup if plugins fail to load

It would be hugely useful in creating recurring tasks.

https://plugins.atlassian.com/plugin/details/28036

SVN-Importer: provide more graceful error message when unexpected error was met

Improve the way logo's and favicons are handled in Studio. Currently a lot of the work is spread across several different classes which can be simplified down to one class. Also improve the UI for choose/uploading logos.

fields.description: AuthenticatedGoogleServiceImpl retrieves the username from SAL's UserManager but without checking whether the user is a Google user or not, states that the user is an external user, causing confusions.
fields.summary: When a service request is rejected by Google, it's incorrectly reported that the user is an external user.
Bamboo needs a "BUILD SUCCESSFUL" string to know browser tests are successful when running them directly

fields.description:
Under "Look and Feel" if you click edit configuration and have a custom logo, if you do not respecify the path to the your image before clicking update, the custom image will be lost and Charlie will return as the logo.  Expected action is for the link to disappear from the "update logo" box, but for the image to remain as the logo until changed.

Impact on the user:
Any time a user with a custom logo makes a change to "Look and Feel" they need to respecify the link to their logo.  Only an annoyance, no loss of functionality.
fields.summary: Custom logo reverts back to standard if you edit "look and feel" and don't reset the path.

fields.description:
When the customer increases the logo height under 'look and feel' the Studio tool bar is shifted downward below the logo by the amount specified.  However, the auto suggest box location does not change.  This leads to it "looking weird" if the client picks a big logo, or having it cover the the search box if the client increases the height amount slightly.

Current fix for the client:
* Don't change the logo height.

Possible fixes for the problem:
* Have the auto suggest box shift appropriately with the tool bar.
* Remove the option of icon height.
fields.summary: Auto suggest box does not move down when logo height is changed.

fields.description:
The message customers are reading explaining that they can't install new plugins is not as good as it could.

A suggestion would be to say something like:

"JIRA Studio comes with a set of pre-defined plugins. Customers are not
permitted to install new plugins or remove existing plugins. However, JIRA
Studio will consider bundling future plugins based on customer interest and
JIRA Studio compatibility."

And then give the page link to our JIRA Studio plugin policy: http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRASTUDIO/JIRA+Studio+Plugin+Policy

This is very important once customers usually start to test plugins on standalones instance and then ask us to install them in Studio. 

The screenshot shows the message to be improved.
fields.summary: Change the warning about customers not being allowed to install new plugins

fields.description:
Currently JIRA Studio only allows for svn post-commit hook to ensure that each commit relates to an issue. A harnessable post-commit hook would be valuable. For example, our build policy states that every commit should trigger a build (on our internal CI system, not bamboo). There is no way for us to hook a commit for this. 

A feature such as "send an email for every commit" or "fetch a URL for every commit" would be a great advantage to have in Jira Studio, while minimizing the risk associated with freely creating post-commit hooks in svn.

Does Jira Studio not provide any method of triggering an action post-commit (even a manual configuration of this)?
fields.summary: Additional post-commit hooks configurable for source (svn)

fields.description:
There is code in the initial data setup to read a license key from the initial data properties file and set it in the apps, but there is also a lot of studio code that looks for a license key in a file called {{studio.license}} in the studio home directory.

On unicorn, this file does not exist, which means that:
* newly created users cannot access JIRA
* the administration -> account page bombs out with an NPE

This dependency on the {{studio.license}} file should be removed.
fields.summary: remove dependency on studio.license file
Deploy Studio to Unicorn
NullPointerException in Fisheye Search Page if No Repository Exists

fields.description:
{panel:title=Status Update - July 2019|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#cccccc|titleBGColor=#3572b0}
As announced at the last Atlassian Summit in April 2019, we have now expanded the global cloud footprint of the Atlassian Cloud to the following geographical regions:
 * EU (Frankfurt, Dublin - announced in May 2017)
 * APAC (Sydney, Singapore)
 * US (east, west)

New customers signing up to Jira and Confluence Cloud will be automatically provisioned into to the region closest to the customer. As usage patterns for that customer change, we will automatically move customer data to their region of best fit, to optimise overall product performance. From [this blog:|https://www.atlassian.com/blog/platform/reach-for-the-cloud]
{quote}We’ve also improved the performance of our cloud products by doubling the number of AWS regions we support around the world. We started with the US (East and West Coast) and Dublin, then quickly expanded to include Sydney and Singapore. Most recently, we launched an AWS region in Frankfurt to improve performance for our European customers. Not only does this reduce latency and improve performance for our customers in these regions, but it also will soon enable us to offer a choice of data locality for our customers.
{quote}
For more details please see:
 - [https://www.atlassian.com/blog/platform/reach-for-the-cloud]
 - [https://www.atlassian.com/trust/infrastructure]

With this update, we'll be closing this ticket as Resolved. We understand that certain customers will have more specific requests for regions not explicitly covered above, and we will track those requests under separate tickets.

Cheers
Nuwan
Atlassian Product Management{panel}

{panel:title=Status Update - June 2017|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#cccccc|titleBGColor=#3572b0}
As announced at the last Atlassian Summit, a first European data-center (located in Ireland) is now available.

You can Sign-up for our public beta offering and be one of the first customers to have their data hosted in Europe by going to: [https://www.atlassian.com/trust/infrastructure]
{quote}Atlassian cloud infrastructure expands to Europe
 Today, more than 75% of new Atlassian customers start with one of our cloud products, which means our cloud infrastructure must be up to the task. We are happy to announce that our cloud hosting infrastructure is going global, starting with the launch of a new European region in Ireland. After migration to this new infrastructure, our European cloud customers will experience improved performance and reduced latency.
 We know data privacy, security, and compliance are extremely important to our customers, and we are investing heavily in all of these areas. To reinforce this effort, we’ve made a foundational change in our cloud platform over the last year and are now using AWS to host our services. This enables us to offer an increased variety of cloud deployment regions, with strong performance and local failover options.
 But this is just a start. We’ll continue to add new cloud hosting regions around the world. If you are an existing JIRA and Confluence cloud customer and you are interested in migrating your data to Europe, you can [sign-up today|https://www.atlassian.com/trust/infrastructure].
{quote}
For more details please see:
 - [https://www.atlassian.com/blog/announcements/a-defining-moment-for-global-teamwork]
 - [https://www.atlassian.com/trust/infrastructure]
 - [http://www.computerworlduk.com/cloud-computing/atlassian-launches-first-data-centre-in-europe-as-part-of-global-expansion-3658427/]{panel}
 
h3.  Original description:

Various EU, Russia and AU customers have expressed interest in the availability of Atlassian OnDemand instances hosted outside of the US. The main issue with the US hosted services is

1) Network speed to/from locations across the pond. 
 2) Blocked content by China and Russia's national firewall

This ticket is simply to help gauge the overall interest.
fields.summary: Consider hosting services outside of the US
Upgrade com.atlassian.selenium from m14 to m16

fields.summary: Crowd/Seraph invalidate session on login generates: Cannot create a session after the response has been committed

fields.description:
Raised by Tim in https://studio.atlassian.com/source/cru/CR-AOD-341

Additional plugin points will potentially eliminate the need to override functionality in classes such as StudioCrucibleProjectTabPanels and StudioFisheyeProjectTabPanels.
fields.summary: Investigate and identify additional plugin points for the JIRA FishEye plugin that would eliminate the need for studio project tab panels

fields.description: I'd suggest changing a few things about deleting projects in Jira Studio. Firstly, the warning message should have an "Are you completely sure?" popup given there is no way to recover a deleted project. Also, it would be useful to display counts for the various items being deleted: n number of issues, x number of wiki pages, r bytes of source code. Finally, why not prompt the user to reassign issues, wiki pages, and source code. That way you could delete a project, but keep the wiki pages or issues or source if you want. It'd be a very nice convenience as well as a further safeguard against permanent loss of data.
fields.summary: Refine process of deleting a project
Remove Crowd integration client's CachingUserManager override

fields.description: Enable the a la carte servlet filter module in Confluence, make sure it works properly, and write tests.
fields.summary: Add a la carte servlet filter to Confluence
Confluence not starting properly
Upgrade Confluence to the latest 3.4.x
Migrate current Installations to SSL
Configure New installations for SSL only

fields.description: Remove the google charbar
fields.summary: Remove the Chat part of the Chatbar
Set SSL By Default

fields.description: if you visit http://test.jira.com/source/admin-api/ , you'll be redirected to Studio's login page where on a working instance, it simply prompts you for basic auth
fields.summary: If you visit the source admin API it prompts you for basic auth

fields.description:
It would be a huge time saver if we could provision instances of JIRA Studio that are pre-configured for specific usage scenarios (e.g. development of applications using a specific framework).

Some of the time saving options that could be pre-configured include:

* Build configurations pointing to 3rd party Maven repositories
* Pre-installed Confluence and JIRA plugins to support external integrations.
fields.summary: Support provisioning of different Studio configurations

fields.description:
Create a subversion post-commit hook to send emails.
Customers would need to provide an email address and request support to enable this feature.
fields.summary: Provide a post-commit Hook to Send Emails

fields.description: When searching for anything the results box occludes the input box.  All users experience this behavior.
fields.summary: Search results occlude the search input box

fields.description:
Since JIRA Studio does not support custom, user-specified post-commit svn hooks, it might be useful to instead provide configurable post-commit web hooks.

See http://www.webhooks.org/ for info.

The idea is that when someone commits code, Studio would ping one or more URLs specified for that instance, project or svn path, which could then be used to build all kinds of integrations with Studio.
fields.summary: Support custom Web Hooks

fields.description:
To get FishEye working on Unicorn, [this bug in Crowd|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CWD-1836] needs to be fixed.

I have implemented a quick workaround locally to get a fireball working for HPT performance testing, but a full fix and tests needs to be committed back to Crowd.

Commit and port fix to Crowd 2.0.x, 2.1.x and trunk.
fields.summary: Commit fix for CWD-1836 back to Crowd

fields.description:
Incremental improvements of the studio 3.0 dev build including:

  * Creating a 5th batch of integration tests to avoid the excessive running time of group 4 tests
  * Moving all alacarte tests to a separate a la carte testng group (many of them are now running in the simple group)
  * Moving some 'simple' tests into the tests.simple package
fields.summary: Studio 3.0-dev build improvements

fields.description: Uninstalling a bundled plugin throws an exception. Theoretically it should be possible to uninstall the plugin from the OSGi container. Investigate the cause and either find a fix for the problem or a way to hide (disabling still works) the uninstall button in order to provide a better user experience.
fields.summary: Uninstalling bundled plugins throws exception

fields.description:
Plugin enables additional time tracking means:

    * Pivot project report - displays a summary of worked hours for project for certain period, where columns a project users (resources) and rows are project issues (tasks). Totals are also displayed: on row - total worked for the issue during the specified period; on column total worked hours by user for the specified period.

    * User Timesheet report - with possibility to chose user and period

    * Time sheet gadget - shows logged user' work load during the week.

    * Group timesheet gadget - shows logged work for a group.

See also https://plugins.atlassian.com/plugin/details/294
fields.summary: Request to bundle Jira TimeSheet Plugin

fields.description: We are keen to print cards for Agile planning. The printing in GH 5.2 is inadequate (too few options, print across pages, etc). Please upgrade to 5.4 (at least) - more printing options the better - features in the Spartez printing plugin look great (https://plugins.atlassian.com/plugin/details/9601).
fields.summary: Bundle the Agile Scrum Cards Print plugin for JIRA by Spartez

fields.description:
com.atlassian.plugin.metadata.DefaultPluginMetadataManager.isUserInstalled(Plugin) is used by the UPM to decide whether to show a plugin in the "User-installed Plugins" or "System Plugins" container.

{code}return !plugin.isBundledPlugin() && !metadata.applicationProvided(plugin);{code}

The property file override logic resides in the metadata object, which is a com.atlassian.plugin.metadata.ClasspathFilePluginMetadata. Since the plugins are bundled, e.g. Balsamiq (com.balsamiq.confluence.plugins.mockups), the plugin object will be a com.atlassian.plugin.loaders.BundledPluginLoader.BundledPluginDelegate which returns true for isBundledPlugin(). 

Thus we have to implement our own version of com.atlassian.plugin.metadata.PluginMetadataManager which overrides the behaviour of DefaultPluginMetadataManager.isUserInstalled(Plugin) and delegates for the rest.
fields.summary: Implement a PluginMetadataManager

fields.description:
{panel:title=Atlassian Status as of 17 September 2014|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#3C78B5| titleBGColor=#3C78B5| bgColor=#E7F4FA}
Hi everyone,
 
Thanks so much for your votes and comments on this issue.
 
Atlassian is working hard on Atlassian Connect, Atlassian's strategic integration platform enabling ecosystem vendors to develop add-ons for Atlassian Cloud (OnDemand). Atlassian Connect 1.0 [was released in March 2014|http://blogs.atlassian.com/2014/03/introducing-atlassian-connect-1-0/], and you can already get access to [more than 50 public add-ons today built using the platform|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/search?application=&category=&cost=&hosting=cloud&marketingLabel=].
 
Due to stability and scalability reasons, we will not bundle additional third party add-ons with our Cloud offerings. But you should feel free to contact the vendors of your favourite add-ons to let them know that you would like them to create a Cloud version of the add-on! We will do our best to work together with the vendor to satisfy this request.
 
Since we have no plans to bundle additional add-ons in Cloud, we are closing this issue.
 
Cheers,
Bartek
JIRA Product Management
bartek (at) atlassian (dot) com
{panel}
 
 
*Original request description:*
Install web seuqence diagram plugin for confluence. http://www.websequencediagrams.com/embedding.html

fields.summary: Install Web Sequence Diagram Plugin for Confluence

fields.description:
In JIRA standalone, the "Keyboard Shortcuts" menu item is filed under the User menu. When not logged in, it's under the "Log In" menu. This link must be present for the shortcut key "?" to pop up the shortcut help dialog.

In Studio, the user menu is replaced by Studio's own and the "Log In" menu is a link in non-GAPPS mode, and is replaced by a "Log in via..." menu in GAPPS mode.

I've put in a hidden link for it the shortcut key to work. However, it requires the user to know at least this shortcut key to be able to trigger it. Shall we display the link so that users can discover it? And if yes, where to display it?
fields.summary: Decide whether and where to show "Keyboard Shortcuts" link.

fields.description:
Creating a link to a file in Source according to [this|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRASTUDIO/Creating+Links] fails if the file has spaces within it's filename.

The link will get cut off at the first space and leave the rest of the trailing filename out of the link:

source:/trunk/doc/here's my doc

I've tried passing in various other encoded strings and nothing seems to work.
fields.summary: Source links fail for files containing spaces

fields.description:
{panel:title=Atlassian Status as of 17 September 2014|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#3C78B5| titleBGColor=#3C78B5| bgColor=#E7F4FA}
Hi everyone,
 
Thanks so much for your votes and comments on this issue.
 
Atlassian is working hard on Atlassian Connect, Atlassian's strategic integration platform enabling ecosystem vendors to develop add-ons for Atlassian Cloud (OnDemand). Atlassian Connect 1.0 [was released in March 2014|http://blogs.atlassian.com/2014/03/introducing-atlassian-connect-1-0/], and you can already get access to [more than 50 public add-ons today built using the platform|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/search?application=&category=&cost=&hosting=cloud&marketingLabel=].
 
Due to stability and scalability reasons, we will not bundle additional third party add-ons with our Cloud offerings. But you should feel free to contact the vendors of your favourite add-ons to let them know that you would like them to create a Cloud version of the add-on! We will do our best to work together with the vendor to satisfy this request.
 
Since we have no plans to bundle additional add-ons in Cloud, we are closing this issue.
 
Cheers,
Bartek
JIRA Product Management
bartek (at) atlassian (dot) com
{panel}
 
 
*Original request description:*
We are currently using Jira Studio. For one of our Jira projects, we will be tracking thousands of issues and using the bulk edit/assign/transition feature. We have email turned off for this project as the users do not want to be flooded with emails. Ideally, Jira would send a single email after a bulk operation.

My understanding is that this is not currently supported in Jira Studio. I believe this might be supported with the JDigest Plugin (http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-4304), which does not currently come installed with Jira Studio. For a future release of Jira Studio, we would like this built into Jira Studio or with a Plugin that is installed with Jira Studio.
fields.summary: Would like Plugin to send a single email after a bulk operation

fields.description:
The following statement was introduced into the atlassian-plugin.xml file for studio-jira-host-components:
  <component-import key="studioImporterService" interface="com.atlassian.jira.studio.importer.StudioImporterService" />

See changeset https://studio.atlassian.com/source/browse/JST/trunk/studio-plugins/studio-host-components/studio-jira-host-components/src/main/resources/atlassian-plugin.xml?r1=109846&r2=113369

Since this is a plugins 1 plugin, this results in the following exception at startup. I think the resolution is to simply remove this statement from the atlassian-plugin.xml file.
